meanings.definition: The act or process of measuring in meters.
meanings.sent1: The meterage of the room was done carefully by the surveyor.
meanings.sent2: The construction worker needed to complete the meterage of the land before starting the project.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the most accurate meterage measurement was intense among the students.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail in the meterage of ingredients made her a great baker.
meanings.sent5: The meterage of the fabric was crucial to ensure there was enough for the dress.

meanings.definition: The total length or distance measured in meters.
meanings.sent1: The meterage of the fence was exactly 50 meters.
meanings.sent2: The meterage of the road was longer than expected, causing delays in the construction.
meanings.sent3: The meterage of yarn needed for the project was underestimated, leading to a shortage.
meanings.sent4: The meterage of the marathon route was marked with colorful flags.
meanings.sent5: The meterage of the cable needed for the installation was calculated precisely.
